answerText: triceratops[10] This dino, whose name means "deceptive lizard," is a large member of the sauropod family that was herbivorous. Before the age of dino-Enlightenment, the Brontosaurus was thought to be one of these critters.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 5 | 20 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about dinosaurs. [10] This dino possesses frills that defend its neck, and two large horns that allow it to attack other aggressors. It is thought that its third horn is vestigial.
